Package researchsim.scenario

Class AnimalController

  • Object
    • AnimalController
  • public class AnimalController
extends Object
    Manager that facilitates the movement of animals on the map.
    Implement this for assignment 2

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AnimalController()
      Creates a new controller with an empty list of animals (Fauna) that it controls.

    • Method Detail

      • getAnimals

        public List<Fauna> getAnimals()
        Returns all the animals that are under this instances control.

        Adding or removing elements from the returned list should not affect the original list.

        Returns:
        all animals that this instance manages
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • addAnimal

        public void addAnimal​(Fauna animal)
        Adds an animal to records of the controller.
        Parameters:
        animal - animal that this instance will now manage
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • removeAnimal

        public void removeAnimal​(Fauna animal)
        Removes an animal from this controller.

        If the animal did not exist then nothing should occur.

        Parameters:
        animal - animal that should be removed
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • move

        public void move()
        Attempts to move a selection of the animals.

        IMPORTANT: This method makes use of a random number so the ORDER of these operations is CRITICAL.
        When this method is called the following occurs:

        1. If the number of animals this method controls (getAnimals() returns an empty list) then the method should immediately return
        2. A random number (num1) is chosen such that: 0 <= num1 < size of animals
          This step should only make one call to Random.nextInt(int).
        3. The following is repeated num1 + 1 times:
          1. A random animal is chosen from the animals list.
            This step should only make one call to Random.nextInt(int).
          2. IF that the number of elements in Fauna.getPossibleMoves() is equal to (=) 0 (that is, it is empty)
            THEN no further action is required for this animal.
          3. IF that the number of elements in Fauna.getPossibleMoves() is 1 equal to (=)
            THEN the animal should move to that coordinate.
          4. IF that the number of elements in Fauna.getPossibleMoves() is greater than (>) 1
            THEN a random coordinate is chosen from the list of possible moves.
            This step should only make one call to Random.nextInt(int).
        The random variable should be retrieved using Scenario.getRandom().
        See Also:
        Random.nextInt(int), Scenario.getRandom(), Fauna.getPossibleMoves()
        Given for assignment 2
